nodes.text: Fantafly polyhedral dice were a type of dice that were used for gambling in the Canto Casino in the city of Canto Bight on the planet Cantonica. They came in a range of different polyhedral shapes and could be gold, silver or bronze in color, with black markings on each face.

Fantafly polyhedral dice first appeared in the film Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi, which was released on December 15, 2017. The props were not named in the film, but received identification in Star Wars: The Last Jedi: The Visual Dictionary, a reference book written by Pablo Hidalgo and released in conjunction with the film. Their name is a reference to the company Fantasy Flight Games, who produce similar looking dice for their Star Wars roleplaying products.
